sentence.Network_en: First you make dead, then you wish to rob his larder.
sentence.Network_cn: 一开始,你先把那个人给弄死了, 这然后,你还想抢掠他的贮藏室.

sentence.Network_en: There is the larder there. Make free with the food.
sentence.Network_cn: 那里有个食品柜, 里面的食物请随意用吧.

sentence.Network_en: Life was much larder in the aftermath of the war.
sentence.Network_cn: 生活在战争的后续状况中更艰苦.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting a store of meat): from Old French lardier, from medieval Latin lardarium, from laridum (see lard)

entry.def: A larder is a room or large cupboard in a house, usually near the kitchen, in which food is kept.

means.word_mean: 1. a supply of food especially for a household
2. a small storeroom for storing foods or wines

auth_sentence.content: This larder will provide food for the family throughout the year.
